intro: Racosperma oligoneurum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for native wildlife. Its seeds are often dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological significance.
